doc.previous: Here the spin variables m assume values from the set
doc.after: where is the spin of th particle for a particle that does not exhibit spin  The treatment of identical particles is very different for bosons particles with integer spin versus fermions particles with half integer spin The above N particle function must either be symmetrized in the bosonic case or anti symmetrized in the fermionic case with respect to the particle numbers If not all N particles are identical but some of them are then the function must be anti symmetrized separately over the variables corresponding to each group of identical variables according to its statistics bosonic or fermionic
